weather_report:
The afternoon in Downtown San Francisco unfolds beneath a moody sky, dense with clouds that drape the city in a blanket of gray. A hint of drizzle clings to the air, whispering of the possibility of rain as the temperature hovers near the cool mid-sixties and begins to gently descend. The south-southeast breeze carries with it the freshness of impending moisture, an invitation to pause and listen to the rhythm of the season. While the chance of precipitation may seem minimal today, the air is saturated with the perfume of damp earth, promising that the clouds will soon spill their contents.

As night approaches, the likelihood of rain intensifies, wrapping the city in an embrace of moisture and stillness. With a low settled in the comfortable mid-fifties, the scene calls for layered clothing—perhaps a light sweater or a water-resistant jacket to ward off the chill and occasional mist. It is the perfect time to seek solace in a cozy café, where the inviting aroma of coffee mingles with the sound of gentle rain against the window. Alternatively, a quiet stroll through the streets, with a keen eye on the changing textures and colors brought on by the weather, could reveal a beauty often missed in clearer skies. Such moments provide a touch of magic, reminding us that even on the grayest of days, there is a palette of experiences waiting to be discovered.
